Resources

Here is a list of resources that we can access.

  • [Buildings][#buildings]

Buildings

This is a list of potential buildings to use for meetings/events.

King Cross Library

They have a mezzanine and a room.

Free to use

West Yorkshire Fire Service

Some stations do offer the use of community rooms; details of those stations that do are as follows:-

  • Halifax
  • Illingworth
  • Todmorden

Free to use

Tesco Community Room

Tesco sometimes have a community room for use. There is a list of 'Community Champions' on their website.

Contact:

Halifax - Kay Mitton - halifax@communityattesco.co.uk

Free to use

Calderdale Council's List of Community Centres

There is a list of community centres on Calderdale Council's website.

Mixenden Youth & Community Centre

Address: Clough Lane, Mixenden, HALIFAX, HX2 8SH

Telephone: 01422 254220

Contact: Sean Wood

Description:

Mixenden Youth Club is a safe and well equipped youth club that has interesting, healthy and fun things to do. Visitor and new members are always welcome.

We are open for 13-19 year olds - Monday, Wednesday and Friday6.45 pm - 9.15 pm We provide activities to help young people become mature adults: sports and indoor games, ICT activities, study support, internet learning, performing arts, outdoor activities, Duke of Edinburgh Award and residential visits. You may also see us out on the streets in our blue jackets and we stop to talk to young people and can offer advice on a variety of issues from housing and sexual health.

Local Activities

Eureka

Eureka is a hands on children's museum in Halifax. It can be very busy and noisy, especially in school holidays but if you ask at the main desk you can often borrow a pair of ear defenders.

Social Story

The Eureka Story project is a brochure designed for children with special needs to access prior to visiting Eureka. This can help relieve any anxieties for the child and help plan and enjoy your visit to Eureka. The booklet was designed by pupil from Cliffe Hill School School and professional involved with special needs in Calderdale.

https://www.eureka.org.uk/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/The-Eureka-Story.pdf
